H0.text: A holiday on 25 March in Greece celebrates the final recognition of Greece as an independent nation following the Greek War of Independence against the Ottoman Empire. What year did this happen. 1821

A4.text: The Treaty of Constantinople (signed on 21 July 1832) set the boundaries of the new Kingdom of Greece along the Artaâ€“Volos line.

A5.text: The borders of the Kingdom were reiterated in the Protocol of London signed on 30 August 1832 by the Great Powers.
